channel.title: Homes on dr. Roland van Rijswijk-Deij
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on dr. Roland van Rijswijk-Deij

item.description: About Me I’m associate professor of Computer Network Security in the Design and Analysis of Communication Systems (DACS) group at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Maths and Computer Science (EEMCS) at the University of Twente. I am also principal scientist at NLnet Labs, a not-for-profit foundation dedicated to research into and open source software for the core protocols of the Internet. For more information, see my CV. Research My research focuses on network security, with two particular areas of interest:

item.title: Selected Publications
item.description: For a list of all my publications, click here, or visit my Google Scholar profile.

item.title: Students
item.description: Ph.D. Candidates Current I am daily supervisor of the following Ph.D. candidates in our group: Moritz Müller Leandro Bertholdo All Ph.D. candidates I supervise are advised by prof. dr. ir. Aiko Pras Graduated Wouter B. de Vries (2019) – thesis Master Students Current NLnet Labs (directly) and other organisations (as university supervisor) including SURFnet and SIDN.-- Etiënne Khan (University of Twente) – co-supervising with dr.
